item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "But I don’t want to go among mad people," Alice remarked. "Oh, you can’t help that," said the Cat: "we’re all mad here. I’m mad. You’re mad." "How do you know I’m mad?" said Alice. "You must be," said the Cat, or you wouldn’t have come here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I used to be Snow White, but I drifted." -- Mae West

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "It's all make believe, isn't it?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I'm very much afraid I didn't mean anything but nonsense. Still, you know, words mean more than we mean to express when we use them; so a whole book ought to mean a great deal more than the writer means. So, whatever good meanings are in the book, I'm glad to accept as the meaning of the book." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "You can't blame a writer for what the characters say." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "To me, the greatest pleasure of writing is not what it's about, but the music the words make." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Writing has laws of perspective, of light and shade just as painting does, or music. If you are born knowing them, fine. If not, learn them. Then rearrange the rules to suit yourself." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Dorlana add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Once writing has become your major vice and greatest pleasure only death can stop it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The hard part about writing a novel is finishing it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dorlana add a quote by Junot Diaz
item.description:
"You see, in my view a writer is a writer not because she writes well and easily, because she has amazing talent, because everything she does is golden. In my view a writer is a writer because even when there is no hope, even when nothing you do shows any sign of promise, you keep writing anyway."
[<i>Becoming a Writer/ The List</i>, O Magazine, November 2009]" -- Junot Diaz
